content.description: Begin with a low, left hand sidepull and a right hand undercling.  Slap up and left to a sloping hold then move up on crimps to the topout.
content.location:
This problem is on the Warm-up Wall located right of the Against Humanity Boulder. There is more info here:

nococlimbing.org/climbing

.

content.description: Sit start on some blocky holds, then climb up to the layback arête and a jug at the top.
content.location: It ascends the left arête of the wall.

content.description: Start low on the undercling at the bottom of a right-trending seam. Move through decent crimps to a first pad pull. Then figure out how to get to the glory jug and casual topout.
content.location:
This is just to the right of

Squeeze Problem

, V6, on the warm-up wall.

content.description:
This climb starts on a good left hand and an incut, half moon-type hold on the right. Climb straight up trending right at the lip. This has great movement on generally okay holds.

Use caution to not swing out left, as there is potential to fall quite a ways.
content.protection: 3 pads and a good spotter to keep you from tumbling down the Warm-up Wall.
content.location: You can find this problem easily by topping out any of the Warm-up Wall problems, it is in a little alcove on top. It is easiest to bring pads up via the downclimb of the Warm-up Wall.
